title: wsvd_julia
text:
This is my website for trying to develop a version of “weighted SVD” (wSVD) in Julia. In doing so I am learning a bit about quarto, a bit about Julia, a bit about vscode…. it’s a learning experience.
By wSVD I mean solving the following problem \[\min \sum_{ij} \tau_{ij}/2 (Y_{ij}-(UV')_{ij})^2\]

title: SVD via ALS
text:
# Notes on project setup
# I tried to set up a Project.toml by:
# opening terminal with julia and press ] to get the package manager
# pkg>  activate ~/git/wsvd_julia
# > add Plots
# > add LowRankApprox
# > add PROPACK
# 
# But i had problems getting the PROPACK package to work this way, for unknown reasons... so I have kept the Pkg.add in the notebook for this

import Pkg; Pkg.add("PROPACK")
using SparseArrays, LinearAlgebra, Plots, LowRankApprox, PROPACK
n = 1000
p = 5000
M = randn(n,p)
  
k = 20
U = randn(n,k)
S = randn(k)
V = randn(p,k)

 # implements als update; based on code in softImpute package (file simpute.als.R)
update_svd_als = function(M,U,S,V)
    for i in 1:100
        UtM = U' * M
        F = svd(UtM)
        V = F.V
        S = F.S
        U = U * F.U

        MV = M * V
        F = svd(MV)
        U = F.U
        S = F.S
        V = V * F.V
    end
    return (U=U,S=S,V=V)
end

# a wrapper for tsvd from PROPACK library
tsvdfact = function(M,k)
    U, S, V, bnd, nprod, ntprod = tsvd(M,k=k)
    return (U=U, S=S, Vt=V')
end

@time F = svd(M)
@time F2 = update_svd_als(M,U,S,V)
@time F3 = psvdfact(M)
@time F4 = tsvdfact(M,3)

println(sum((M-F.U[:,1:3] * diagm(F.S[1:3]) * F.Vt[1:3,:]).^2))
println(sum((M-F2.U * diagm(F2.S) * F2.V').^2))
println(sum((M-F3.U[:,1:3] * diagm(F3.S[1:3]) * F3.Vt[1:3,:]).^2))
println(sum((M-F4.U[:,1:3] * diagm(F4.S[1:3]) * F4.Vt[1:3,:]).^2))

   Resolving package versions...
  No Changes to `~/.julia/scratchspaces/4c0109c6-14e9-4c88-93f0-2b974d3468f4/loader.1.10.4.3YfPsfN0smr/Project.toml`
  No Changes to `~/.julia/scratchspaces/4c0109c6-14e9-4c88-93f0-2b974d3468f4/loader.1.10.4.3YfPsfN0smr/Manifest.toml`

scatter(F.V[:,2],F2[:V][:,2])

Now try the same thing with a sparse matrix

M = sprand(n,p,0.01)
 
#@time F = svd(M)
@time F2 = update_svd_als(M,U,S,V)
@time F3 = psvdfact(M)
@time F4 = tsvdfact(M,3)

println(sum((M-F2.U * diagm(F2.S) * F2.V').^2))
println(sum((M-F3.U[:,1:3] * diagm(F3.S[1:3]) * F3.Vt[1:3,:]).^2))
println(sum((M-F4.U[:,1:3] * diagm(F4.S[1:3]) * F4.Vt[1:3,:]).^2))
